greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: G.f. A(x) satisfies: A( A( x - x^2 ) ) = x + x^2.
comment: a(2^k-1) = 1 (mod 2) and a(2^(k+1)-2) = 1 (mod 2) for k >= 1, and a(n) is even elsewhere (conjecture).
link: Paul D. Hanna, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..300
formula: (2a) A(A(x)) = 2*C(x) - x, where C(x) = x + C(x)^2 is a g.f. of the Catalan numbers (A000108).
Define B(x) = (A(x) - A(-x))/2 and Catalan series C(x) = x + C(x)^2, then
example: such that A(A(x - x^2)) = x + x^2.
(b) The odd bisection B(x) = (A(x) - A(-x))/2 begins
such that B(x)^2 yields the even bisection (A(x) + A(-x))/2
(d) Note that A(x - x^2) equals the series reversion of B(x):
where B( A(x  -x^2) ) = x and A( B(x) - B(x)^2 ) = x.
program: (PARI) /* Using A(A( x - x^2 )) = x + x^2. */
{a(n) = my(A=x+x*O(x^n)); for(i=1,n, A = A + (x+x^2 - subst(A,x,subst(A,x,x-x^2)) )/2 ); polcoeff(A,n)}
results.author: _Paul D. Hanna_, Sep 06 2018
